snippet: Groupon's net income was slightly above the expectations of Wall Street analysts, but the revenue number fell short, reports Quentin Hardy of The New York Times. The news sent its shares down more than 14 percent in after-hours trading.
abstract: Groupon's net income was slightly above the expectations of Wall Street analysts, but the revenue number fell short, reports Quentin Hardy of The New York Times. The news sent its shares down more than 14 percent in after-hours trading.

headline.main: Groupon Falls in After-Hours Trading on Earnings Report
